layer.name: Sacrifice
layer.definition: Pour out for others with no expectation of return.

questions.text: My life being oriented toward giving (not accumulating) is ...

answers.5: central — my trajectory is to pour out
answers.3: partial — giving is part of my life
answers.1: not true — I'm focused on building

questions.text: Working toward 'dying broke' in money, time, AND relationships is ...

answers.4: intentional — I'm moving in this direction
answers.5: the plan — full depletion in service of others
answers.3: emerging — I'm beginning to think this way
answers.1: not my goal — I want to leave a legacy

questions.text: Sacrificing across all dimensions (spirit, soul, body) — not just easy areas — is ...

answers.2: limited — I sacrifice in some areas
answers.3: moderate — I give in most areas
answers.1: rare — I give where it's comfortable

questions.text: Giving at levels that genuinely cost me (not just comfortable giving) is ...

answers.4: regular — I give until it hurts

questions.text: Seeing my accumulated resources as held in trust for others (steward, not owner) is ...

answers.1: not how I think — I earned it

remediation.advice: Integrated sacrifice means your whole life is oriented toward giving, not just isolated acts of generosity. The goal is to end with nothing held back — to have poured out money, time, and relational investment for others. If you're accumulating in any dimension without a plan to give it away, examine why.

scripture.text: For whoever would save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for my sake will find it.
